abstract: It was just yesterday that DealBook was observing how Vonage Holdings, the Internet phone company, has the dubious honor of being the worst initial public offering, by far, of 2006. Then came word Thursday morning that Vonage’s chief executive, Michael Snyder, has abruptly stepped down and resigned from Vonages’ its board of directors. Thursday’s news release gave no reason for Mr. Snyder’s departure, but the company is clearly in crisis mode. Its stock has lost more than 80 percent of its value since it went public in May, and Vonage is at risk of losing access to an important piece of technology that is the subject of a patent dispute with Verizon.
